DOC.brief_summary: This study compare ability two type long term ( 12 month ) weight-bearing exercise treatment ( 1. high-intensity jumping 2. weight lift ) increase bone mass total body , spine hip physically active men osteopenia .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Plyometrics Increase Bone Mass Men With Osteopenia
DOC.detailed_description: The overall goal project determine efficacy chronic ( 12 month ) plyometric jump training exercise bone mineral density ( BMD ) markers bone turnover physically active male cyclist diagnose osteopenia normal bone mineral density lumbar spine hip .
DOC.criteria: Male Age 2560 year No symptom disease Currently participate cycle activity average 4 hr/wk previous 24 month Osteopenia lumbar spine and/or hip ( T score < 1.0 > 2.5 ) Medications supplement affect bone metabolism prevent exercise Previous current medical condition affect bone health Osteoporosis lumbar spine and/or hip ( T score > 1.0 < 2.5 ) Cardiovascular disease Metallic implant Current smoker Current regular participation highintensity resistance training and/or plyometrics
